intro: Crucifera eckartsbergensis, commonly known as the Eckartsberg mustard, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and elongated, slender stems. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has small, serrated leaves. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several small, round seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native habitat.
